title: Robert Hunter, lyricist who with Jerry Garcia wrote many of the Grateful Dead’s most admired songs – obituary
text:
Robert Hunter, who has died aged 78, was a musician who wrote the lyrics to some of the Grateful Dead’s best-loved songs; in one interview he was asked about his influences, and replied that “just to throw people off” he would cite both Gilbert and Sullivan and Woody Guthrie. He paused, and said: “Actually, that’s pretty close to the truth.”

Although he could play the guitar, violin, cello and trumpet, he never appeared on stage with the band.
